Name: Bulawayo
Description: The second-largest city in Zimbabwe, known for its industrial and cultural significance.

Name: Harare
Description: The capital city and largest urban center of Zimbabwe, known for its political and economic importance.

Name: Manicaland
Description: A province known for its beautiful landscapes, mountains, and agriculture.

Name: Mashonaland Central
Description: A region known for its farming, particularly tobacco, maize, and cotton.

Name: Mashonaland East
Description: Known for its rich agricultural land and proximity to the capital city of Harare.

Name: Mashonaland West
Description: A region characterized by large commercial farms and a mix of both rural and urban settlements.

Name: Masvingo
Description: Known for the Great Zimbabwe ruins and its significant agricultural output.

Name: Matinga
Description: A region with abundant wildlife, part of Zimbabwe major tourist destinations.

Name: Midlands
Description: A central region, known for its mining and agriculture.

Name: Matabeleland North
Description: Known for its natural resources, including gold, and its proximity to the Hwange National Park.

Name: Matabeleland South
Description: A province rich in natural resources, especially in mining and wildlife.
